meanings.definition: To remove a pin or pins from (something)
meanings.sent1: She unpins the note from the board.
meanings.sent2: He carefully unpins the fabric to make adjustments.
meanings.sent3: The magician unpins the card from his sleeve, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: She unpins the memory from her mind, letting go of the past.
meanings.sent5: The detective unpins the clue, revealing the hidden truth.

meanings.definition: To release or free from being pinned or fastened
meanings.sent1: The wrestler unpins his opponent to win the match.
meanings.sent2: She unpins the tangled necklace from her hair.
meanings.sent3: The superhero quickly unpins the hostages, saving the day.
meanings.sent4: He unpins the butterfly from the net, setting it free.
meanings.sent5: The key unpins the lock, opening the treasure chest.
